trait.name: Morale
entries: When the spore bloom is bloodied (15), it must succeed on a {@dc 9} Wisdom saving throw or go limp and play dead for the remainder of the combat.

action.name: Spore Burst
entries: Cooldown 3. The spore bloom launches a spore to a location within 60 ft. The spore bursts into a 15 ft. cube cloud of poisonous gas that lingers for 8 hours or until dispersed by wind-producing magic.

action.name: Throw Thorn
entries: {@atk r} {@hit +4} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 piercing damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Nature DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: Spore blooms seem to be single enormous flowers at first glance, colored bright yellow and shot through with orange. Then they heave their bulk out of the ground and start moving.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Created in a desperate attempt to stop the advance of blind hunger, the spore blooms may have killed more Bridgers than Gluttons in the end.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the hedge sentry is bloodied (11 hp), it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or "play dead" for the remainder of the combat.

trait.name: Thorns
entries: Any creature that strikes the hedge sentry with a melee attack takes 2 points of piercing damage.

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 damage, and the target is {@condition grappled}. If the hedge sentry already had a target {@condition grappled}, the old target is released. The target may take an action to escape the grapple with a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw.

action.name: Crush
entries: Deal 8 bludgeoning damage to a {@condition grappled} target.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Nature DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: The hedge sentry is an ambulatory tangle of thorny vines.

entries.name: Lore
entries: When the guardian spirit Teron was corrupted and turned on Skybridge, so too did the rest of the barrier forest.

action.name: Spectral Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 slashing damage.

action.name: Spectral Walk
entries: The spirit fades into insubstantiality. It provokes attacks of opportunity from creatures adjacent to it when it fades. While faded, the spirit cannot take damage from any source, and it can phase through creatures, obstacles, and difficult terrain. The spirit becomes substantial again at the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: A spectral soldier going through the motions of a last, desperate battle.

entries.name: Lore
entries: As Hadriel constructed his Wall, the remaining Bridger army took an oath to defend it even beyond death. None of them anticipated being held to the promise.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the spirit is bloodied (5), it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or flee from battle.

action.name: Spectral Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit +6} to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. {@h}5 damage. The target is surrounded by a spectral mist until the beginning of the spirit's next turn, making them difficult to see. All attacks against them have disadvantage while the mist remains.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the spirit is bloodied (4), it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or flee from combat.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: A spectral mage in Bridger colors. More likely than its fellow soldiers to understand that it is dead.

entries.name: Lore
entries: I never thought I would see the day that I would curse my own soul to undeath. But it's worth it to stop the blind hunger. It has to be.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the gluttonous maw is bloodied (5), it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or flee the battle.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The gluttonous maw has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 damage. The gluttonous maw regains 2 HP.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: With a short, bulbous body and spindly arms and legs, the maw would almost look cute... without the mouth that takes up most of its body. A swarm of such mouths grinning at you from the dark is even less appealing.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Three years into the long dark, maintenance workers reported grinning mouths in the shadows. If Skybridge's leaders had understood what these reports truly meant, much tragedy could have been prevented.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the gluttonous berserker is bloodied (19), it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or fly into a rage, attacking the nearest creature, friend or foe, for the rest of the combat.

trait.name: Vengeance Seeker
entries: When a creature damages the gluttonous berserker, the gluttonous berserker gains advantage on attacks against that creature until the end of the gluttonous berserker's next turn.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 damage. The gluttonous berserker restores 6 HP.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 damage. The target falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Charge
entries: The gluttonous berserker moves up to twice its speed in a straight line, shoving creatures aside 5 ft in either direction as it does. It may make a Slam attack against each creature it shoves this way.
The gluttonous berserker may not move before or after a Charge.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: The berserker's body follows an ape's body plan, with relatively short legs and arms that drag on the ground. Smooth, stonelike black skin is broken only by an enormous mouth in the center of the berserker's torso.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Berserkers were the low-value shock troops of the Blind Hunger's army. They were sent to terrify lesser Bridger soldiers and prepare the way for greater Gluttons. Now that they are no longer useful to their masters, they are left to rot on the outskirts.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Neiven's shade and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Neiven's shade dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When Neiven's shade reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it transforms into Neiven's Shade (phase 2). In so doing, it gains all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and recovers from any status affects afflicting it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Neiven's shade makes two force bolt attacks.

action.name: Force Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit +4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 force damage.

action.name: Arcane Mark
entries: Cooldown 3. Neiven's shade can mark a creature within 30 ft. with a shining rune. While the creature is marked like this, Neiven's shade knows its exact location and has advantage on attacks against it. The creature or one of its allies may remove the mark with an action by disrupting it.

action.name: Pillar of Force
entries: Cooldown 3. Neiven's shade calls down a pillar on one target currently marked by Arcane Mark. The pillar deals 8 force damage unavoidably.

reaction.name: Defensive Teleport
entries: As a reaction when targeted with an attack, Neiven's shade may teleport up to 15 ft. in any direction, imposing disadvantage on the attack in the process.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Neiven's shade and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Neiven's shade dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Neiven's shade rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order, where it has all its possible actions. Its reaction refreshes at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Fade Step
entries: Whenever Neiven's shade moves, it disappears in one place and appears in another instantaneously, avoiding all opportunity attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Neiven's shade makes two force bolt attacks.

action.name: Force Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit +4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 force damage.

action.name: Arcane Mark
entries: Cooldown 3. Neiven's shade can mark a creature within 30 ft. with a shining rune. While the creature is marked like this, Neiven's shade knows its exact location and has advantage on attacks against it. The creature or one of its allies may remove the mark with an action by disrupting it.

action.name: Pillar of Force
entries: Cooldown 3. Neiven's shade calls down a pillar on one target currently marked by Arcane Mark. The pillar deals 8 force damage unavoidably.

reaction.name: Defensive Teleport
entries: As a reaction when targeted with an attack, Neiven's shade may teleport up to 15 ft. in any direction, imposing disadvantage on the attack in the process.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: Neiven was clearly once the very image of an archmage. Noble features, intense bearing, and impeccable presentation. The lesser mages that followed him clearly imitated his style. Now, his eyes are clouded, and he howls with madness after a century of undeath.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Do you remember when we were both apprentices, Elle? High off our accomplishment of sealing the Change Engine. It felt like magic could do anything. Maybe that promise will be fulfilled in Avandra's halls. I'll be waiting there for you, Elle.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The poisonous hunger and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the poisonous hunger dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When the poisonous hunger reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it transforms into the poisonous hunger (phase 2). In so doing, it gains all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and recovers from any status affects afflicting it.

trait.name: Poison Stride
entries: While the poisonous hunger is within a poisonous cloud, the poison eddies around it in confusing patterns, giving attackers disadvantage.

trait.name: Poisoned Fangs
entries: If the poisonous hunger starts its turn in a poison cloud, its attacks deal an additional 4 poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The poisonous hunger makes one slam attack and one devour attack.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 damage. The poisonous hunger restores 3 hp.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 damage.

reaction.name: Poison Puff
entries: When damaged, the poisonous hunger may use a reaction to emit a 10 ft square of poison gas. The poisonous hunger must be within one of the squares.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The poisonous hunger and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the poisonous hunger dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: The poisonous hunger rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Poison Stride
entries: While the poisonous hunger is within a poisonous cloud, the poison eddies around it in confusing patterns, giving attackers disadvantage.

trait.name: Poisoned Fangs
entries: If the poisonous hunger starts its turn in a poison cloud, its attacks deal an additional 4 poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The poisonous hunger makes two claw attacks and one devour attack.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 damage. The poisonous hunger restores 3 hp.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 damage.

action.name: Scatter Affliction
entries: Cooldown 3. The poisonous hunger may move up to 60 ft. in a straight line, moving through creatures' spaces as it does, and leaving behind a line of poisonous gas. The poisonous hunger may not move before or after scattering affliction.

reaction.name: Poison Puff
entries: When damaged, the poisonous hunger may use a reaction to emit a 10 ft square of poison gas. The poisonous hunger must be within one of the squares.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: The most humanoid of all the gluttons seen so far, this one still shares their characteristic obsidian skin and eyeless, toothy grin. This one is stretched out, tall and painfully thin, with long fingers that can gouge or slam. An odd jewel glints on its chest.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Gluttons that grow old without being eaten by their betters mutate in strange ways, growing larger, more cunning, and often acquiring strange abilities. This one has consumed so many poisonous plants in the barrier forest that it has become a creature of toxin itself.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The grave guardian and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the grave guardian dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Resilliency
entries: The grave guardian has three health totals, which deplete one at a time. When one health total is depleted, the grave guardian gains a second wind, recovering from any status effect affecting it. When all health totals are depleted, the grave guardian dies.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: The grave guardian rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Embed
entries: The grave guardian starts the fight embedded in the ground, granting it +1 AC (total 16), but setting its speed to 0 ft. When the grave guardian's first health pool is depleted, it pulls itself out of the ground, ending both the increased AC and decreased speed.

action.name: Restless Spirit
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit +2} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 necrotic damage. The target is {@condition charmed} for 1 round.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 bludgeoning damage. The target is pushed 10 ft. and falls {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Restless Defense
entries: As a reaction when damaged, make a restless spirit attack against the source of the damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: At first, this creature resembles simply an earthen mound filled with long-bleached skeletons, but it quickly becomes obvious it is anything but as it pulls itself into a vaguely humanoid shape. In the approximate location of a head, a single flame burns with rage.

entries.name: Lore
entries: No... no. Not like this. We've already made it this far. Where's the escort, there was supposed to be an escort! Get your hands off him you monsters! ... there was supposed to be an escort ... {@bold you'll all regret this}

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Wymare and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Wymare dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When Wymare reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it transforms into Wymare, Spectral Captain (Part 2). In so doing, it gains all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and recovers from any status affects afflicting it.

action.name: Seeking Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. {@h}3 damage, and the target is marked out in silver light until the beginning of Wymare's next turn. This light temporarily suppresses any effect imposing disadvantage on attacks against the target and grants Wymare's allies advantage to hit the target.

bonus.name: Lay on Hands
entries: Wymare may touch an adjacent ally or himself to heal 3 damage.

reaction.name: Loyal Guards
entries: As a reaction when Wymare would be the target of an attack, he may force the attack to target an adjacent ally instead.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Wymare and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Wymare dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Wymare rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order, where it has all its possible actions. Its reaction refreshes at the beginning of each turn.

action.name: Seeking Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 damage, and the target is marked out in silver light until the beginning of Wymare's next turn. This light temporarily suppresses any effect imposing disadvantage on attacks against the target and grants Wymare's allies advantage to hit the target.

bonus.name: Lay on Hands
entries: Wymare may touch an adjacent ally or himself to heal 3 damage.

reaction.name: Ultimate Loyalty
entries: As a reaction when Wymare would be the target of an attack, he may teleport an ally within 30 ft. to a space adjacent to him and force the attack to target the teleported ally instead.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: The eyes of this former commander still barely cling to sanity, but they seem to see little of what is in front of them. His shield and breastplate bear the sigil of a flame, and remnants of a forgotten holy power still flicker around his fingers.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Every second counts to get the remaining civilians relocated behind Hadriel's wall. If we are to die here, we will make them pay for every inch with blood. May our corpses rise up to continue the fight, should it be necessary.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The bloated glutton and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the bloated glutton dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When the bloated glutton reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it transforms into Bloated Glutton (Phase 2). In so doing, it gains all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and recovers from any status affects afflicting it.

action.name: Vortex
entries: The bloated glutton spits a bead of twisted space up to 60 ft away, which explodes into a 15 ft cube of spatial distortion. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 4 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tongue Lash
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and pulled 5 ft. towards the bloated glutton. Until the grapple ends, the bloated glutton cannot use tongue lash on another target.

bonus.name: Devour
entries: If the bloated glutton has a target {@condition grappled} with its Tongue Lash, it may pull that target 5 ft. closer to itself and deal 4 bludgeoning damage to it. The bloated glutton restores 2 hp.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The bloated glutton and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the bloated glutton dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: The bloated glutton rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

action.name: Vortex
entries: The bloated glutton spits a bead of twisted space up to 60 ft away, which explodes into a 15 ft cube of spatial distortion. Each creature that enters the area or starts its turn in it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 4 force damage on a failed save, or 2 force damage on a successful one.

The vortex stays in place until the bloated glutton dismisses it, or until it tries to create more than 3 vortices. When the bloated glutton spits a new vortex when there are already 3 present, the oldest vortex fades away to make room for the new one.

action.name: Vacuum
entries: The bloated glutton breathes in, creating an enormous vacuum. All creatures within 30 ft. of the bloated glutton must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pulled 10 ft. towards the bloated glutton.

action.name: Tongue Lash
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and pulled 5 ft. towards the bloated glutton. Until the grapple ends, the bloated glutton cannot use tongue lash on another target.

bonus.name: Devour
entries: If the bloated glutton has a target {@condition grappled} with its Tongue Lash, it may pull that target 5 ft. closer to itself and deal 4 bludgeoning damage to it. The bloated glutton restores 2 hp.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 14

entries.name: Description
entries: The mound of jet-black flesh in the center of the room quivers as you enter, spitting apart to reveal a toothy maw large enough to swallow you whole. A glistening red tongue quests out from between the fangs, seemingly tasting the air for you.

entries.name: Lore
entries: When gluttons become so large that they cannot defend themselves, they are usually eaten by their fellows. Some rare few are lucky enough to surround themselves with minor gluttons that dare not challenge them.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Teron and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Teron dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When Teron reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it transforms into Corrupted Teron (Phase 2). In so doing, it gains all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and recovers from any status affects afflicting it.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Teron rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Poison Stride
entries: While Teron is within a poisonous cloud, the poison eddies around it in confusing patterns, giving attackers disadvantage.

action.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Cooldown 3. Teron spits a cloud of poison, creating a 15 ft. cube of poisonous gas within 60 ft.. The cloud is dispersed by wind-producing magic, but otherwise remains for 8 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Teron makes three attacks: one bite and two snatches.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 piercing damage.

action.name: Snatch
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 bludgeoning damage, and the target is dragged adjacent to Teron and {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

bonus.name: Toss
entries: {@atk r} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Requires {@condition grappled} creature, which is thrown to a space adjacent to the target. {@h}Both creatures take 2 bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone}. {@m}Only the thrown creature takes the damage and falls {@condition prone}.
Teron can direct this attack at an empty space instead of a creature, in which case the {@condition grappled} creature is thrown to that space, takes the damage, and falls {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Teron and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Teron dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When Teron reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it transforms into Corrupted Teron (Phase 3). In so doing, it gains all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and recovers from any status affects afflicting it.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Teron rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

action.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Cooldown 3. Teron spits a cloud of poison, creating a 15 ft. cube of poisonous gas within 60 ft.. The cloud is dispersed by wind-producing magic, but otherwise remains for 8 hours.

action.name: Snatch
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 bludgeoning damage, and the target is dragged adjacent to Teron and {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

bonus.name: Toss
entries: {@atk r} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Requires {@condition grappled} creature, which is thrown to a space adjacent to the target. {@h}Both creatures take 6 bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone}. {@m}Only the thrown creature takes the damage and falls {@condition prone}.
Teron can direct this attack at an empty space instead of a creature, in which case the {@condition grappled} creature is thrown to that space, takes the damage, and falls {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Teron and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Teron dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Teron rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

action.name: Phase
entries: Teron goes briefly out-of-phase with reality. Until the end of Teron's turn, he gains a 40 ft. fly speed and he can pass through obstacles and creatures. He does not provoke attacks of opportunity while phased. All creatures passed through this way must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, taking 7 radiant damage on a failed save, or 3 radiant damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Teron makes three attacks: one bite and two claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 slashing damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 14

entries.name: Description (plant form)
entries: The mass of vines blocking the way further into Skybridge  pulls itself up, painfully and slowly, until it has assumed the rough guise of a gold dragon. Its form droops as though it can barely hold itself together, but it bares its teeth at you in challenge anyway.

entries.name: Description (spirit form)
entries: The hope of victory is dashed as a thin, ghostly form tears itself out of the charred plant matter. A pulsing black core of corruption is now visible at the heart of the dragon's ghost. Still, it pushes through its pain and roars its defiance at you.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Teron was the city's hero once. He fought off army-killing astral dreadnoughts. He willingly entered hibernation so that others could eat during Folmer's famine. A pity that he might have ended more lives than he ever saved, after being corrupted by Hunger.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the elder berserker is bloodied (30), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or fly into a rage, attacking the nearest creature, friend or foe, for the rest of the combat.

trait.name: Vengeance Seeker
entries: When a creature damages the elder berserker, the elder berserker gains advantage on attacks against that creature until the end of the elder berserker's next turn.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). The elder berserker may grapple only one target in this way. If it devours another target, it frees the first.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk m} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 bludgeoning damage. The target falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Charge
entries: The elder berserker moves up to twice its speed in a straight line, shoving creatures aside 5 ft in either direction as it does. It may make a Slam attack against each creature it shoves this way.
The elder berserker may not move before or after a Charge.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: The elder berserker looks much like its smaller cousins, but for small bone spurs emerging from its skin around the joints. It is obviously capable of incredible strength, but moves stiffly.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Where berserkers were sent to break the dregs of the Bridger army, their elders were sent to do the same for the Bridger adventurers. Now they guard locations that are important to the Hunger.

bonus.name: Chew
entries: Requires a {@condition grappled} target. The target takes 8 piercing damage, and the elder berserker heals 4 hp.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the gluttonous warper is bloodied (16), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 piercing damage. The gluttonous warper restores 5 hp.

action.name: Fold Space
entries: The gluttonous warper folds space around itself to protect itself from harm. To others, it appears as a warped silhouette. While folded in this way, it cannot be targeted with attacks and it gains advantage on dexterity saving throws, but it cannot take any actions except movement and unfolding space.

bonus.name: Unfold Space
entries: The gluttonous warper returns to contiguous space, causing a spatial shockwave in adjacent squares as it does. Each creature in this area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: This creature actually has a head, but it still lacks any features other than a grinning, fanged mouth. It wears a cloak made of bone and tendon. The bone shards gently knock against one another as the creature sways, a disturbingly gentle sound.

entries.name: Lore
entries: The first Glutton to be seen by a Bridger was a warper. Lord Qhen summoned it as his last act before his flayer host was forced off of Skybridge. Those present said it simply stood in one place for a time, smiling, before disappearing in a pop of tortured space.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the crusher vine is bloodied (45), it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or go limp and play dead for the remainder of the combat.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: By remaining very still, the crusher vine may deceive enemies into believing it is a non-animate plant. It takes a {@dc 15} perception check to notice that a crusher vine is animate when it is holding still this way.

trait.name: Pod
entries: The crusher vine has a pod large enough to hold one medium size creature. While inside the pod, a creature cannot see any creature besides the crusher vine. If a creature escapes from the crusher vine's entangle while within the pod, it is still considered {@condition grappled} (but not {@condition restrained}), until it has also escaped the pod ({@dc 13} Strength check). The crusher vine has advantage on attack rolls to entangle a creature inside its pod.

action.name: Entangle
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is also {@condition restrained}. Only one target can be {@condition grappled} in this way. If the crusher vine would like to entangle another target, it must release the first.

action.name: Poison Dart
entries: {@atk r} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. {@h}16 piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition poisoned}, and must use 10 ft. of their movement to stumble in a random direction at the beginning of each of their turns. The target may repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themself on a success.

bonus.name: Crush
entries: Requires a target {@condition grappled} by entangle. If the target is not within the crusher vine's pod, the vine pulls the target into the pod. The target takes 12 bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Nature DC 16

entries.name: Description
entries: What seemed to be a single enormous seedpod spits open as you approach, flailing tentacles lolling out of the gaping pod like tongues. The inside of the pod is lined with wicked-looking spikes that glisten with a clear liquid.

entries.name: Lore
entries: The magical laboratories once took safety and proper materials storage very seriously. These days, with the old workstations inhabited by creatures of Chaos, standards are significantly more lax. Just look at this charming creature for evidence.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Chandra and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Chandra dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When Chandra reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it transforms into Soul of Chandra (Phase 2). In so doing, it gains all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and recovers from any status affects afflicting it.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Chandra rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Spectral Charge
entries: If Chandra moves at least 20 ft. in a straight line and then makes a shield bash attack, she may pass through creatures or objects in her path and does not provoke opportunity attacks during the movement. If the shield bash attack hits, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. If the target falls {@condition prone}, Chandra may make a stab attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stab
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. This attack automatically hits {@condition prone} targets. {@h}16 piercing damage.

action.name: Fireblast
entries: Chandra bashes her blade against her shield, producing a blast of fire that pushes all creatures within 10 ft. of Chandra back 5 ft.. All creatures pushed this way must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 12 fire damage and falling {@condition prone} on a failure, or 6 fire damage on a success.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Chandra and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Chandra dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Chandra rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order, where it has all its possible actions. Its reaction refreshes at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Blazing Charge
entries: If Chandra moves at least 20 ft. in a straight line and then lets out a fireblast, she may pass through creatures or objects in her path and does not provoke opportunity attacks during the movement. If there are any {@condition prone} targets after the fireblast within 10 ft., Chandra may make a flame lash attack against one of them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Torchbearer's Armor
entries: If Chandra is damaged by a melee attack, the attacker takes 12 fire damage.

trait.name: Paragon Resilliency
entries: Chandra has two health totals, which deplete one at a time. When one health total is depleted, Chandra gains a second wind, recovering from any status effect affecting it. When all health totals are depleted, Chandra dies.

action.name: Flame Lash
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. This attack automatically hits {@condition prone} targets. {@h}18 fire damage.

action.name: Fireblast
entries: Chandra bashes her blade against her shield, producing a blast of fire that pushes all creatures within 10 ft. of Chandra back 5 ft.. All creatures pushed this way must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 12 fire damage and falling {@condition prone} on a failure, or 6 fire damage on a success.

action.name: Fiery Path
entries: After activating fiery path and until the end of her turn, Chandra leaves a 5 ft. wide wall of fire behind her as she moves. The wall starts at ground level beneath Chandra and extends 10 ft. into the air. The wall gutters out after 1 round.
Any creature that enters the wall or starts its turn there must make a {@dc 16} Saving throw, taking 12 fire damage on a failure.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 17

entries.name: Description (first form)
entries: The ghost of the warrior before you glows with a warm red light, unlike the other ghosts that you've seen whose light was pale. She holds her sword and shield in front of her in a formal posture, emphasizing her heraldry: a blazing torch.

entries.name: Description (second form)
entries: The ghostly knight steps back to reevaluate her tactics. She discards her sword and shield to gather fire magic in both palms. The flame grows brighter, seemingly consuming her, but instead it simply seems to dance on her armor. She extends a long whip of flame from one hand, and settles into a combat stance again.

entries.name: Lore
entries: The Order of Torchbearers were charged with keeping away the dangers of the Shadow Era. They failed, and to atone, the last member of their order set fire to her own flesh for the merest chance of holding back Hunger. Though she gave her life, she also gave the Void Whisperer its only wound.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the chaos slaad smasher is bloodied (18), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

trait.name: Chaotic Nature
entries: The chaos slaad's form is unstable, constantly shifting and bubbling. At the start of the chaos slaad's turn, roll a {@dice 1d3}. Depending on the result of the roll, the chaos slaad might change stat blocks. If it changes stat blocks, it retains its current hit point total and all conditions currently affecting it, but otherwise replaces all of its statistics with those of the new stat block. The possible stat blocks are:
1. Chaos Slaad Smasher
2. Chaos Slaad Hurler
3. Chaos Slaad Barrier

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The chaos slaad regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Club Arm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 bludgeoning damage and 5 acid damage. The target must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: The creature would look almost like a toad if you twisted it to allow it walk on two legs. Its skin is gray and pockmarked, and its entire body shifts and bubbles in a nauseating way. This form is awkwardly top-heavy, with a huge club arm.

entries.name: Lore
entries: The Slaad were seen as little more than pests during the years of the Long Dark before Skybridge's final fall. That may have been true once, but they have had years to fester inside Skybridge's corpse, and they're rather more than that now.

trait.name: Chaotic Nature
entries: The chaos slaad's form is unstable, constantly shifting and bubbling. At the start of the chaos slaad's turn, roll a {@dice 1d3}. Depending on the result of the roll, the chaos slaad might change stat blocks. If it changes stat blocks, it retains its current hit point total and all conditions currently affecting it, but otherwise replaces all of its statistics with those of the new stat block. The possible stat blocks are:
1. Chaos Slaad Smasher
2. Chaos Slaad Hurler
3. Chaos Slaad Barrier

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The chaos slaad regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the chaos slaad hurler is bloodied (18), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

action.name: Acid Glob
entries: The chaos slaad hurler throws a glob of acid to a location within 60 ft. The glob bursts into a 15 ft. cube of acid. Each creature in the cube must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 acid damage on a failed save.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: The creature would look almost like a toad if you twisted it to allow it walk on two legs. Its skin is gray and pockmarked, and its entire body shifts and bubbles in a nauseating way. This form is small except for a distended gut from which it vomits up globs of acid.

entries.name: Lore
entries: The Slaad hail from the chaos plane of Limbo, and tend to resist any formal attempt to organize or force them into anything. Particularly clever or strong Slaad sometimes trick or intimidate other Slaad into a temporary semblance of order.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the chaos slaad barrier is bloodied (18), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

trait.name: Chaotic Nature
entries: The chaos slaad's form is unstable, constantly shifting and bubbling. At the start of the chaos slaad's turn, roll a {@dice 1d3}. Depending on the result of the roll, the chaos slaad might change stat blocks. If it changes stat blocks, it retains its current hit point total and all conditions currently affecting it, but otherwise replaces all of its statistics with those of the new stat block. The possible stat blocks are:
1. Chaos Slaad Smasher
2. Chaos Slaad Hurler
3. Chaos Slaad Barrier

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The chaos slaad regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Acid Burst
entries: Any creature that strikes the chaos slaad barrier with a melee attack takes 3 points of acid damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: The creature would look almost like a toad if you twisted it to allow it walk on two legs. Its skin is gray and pockmarked, and its entire body shifts and bubbles in a nauseating way. This form is short, stout, and covered with pulsing acid nodules.

entries.name: Lore
entries: It was said that Avandra needed Kord's help to build the Chaos Engine. Even though the Chaos Engine was the key to the survival of Skybridge, many wonder if it was truly worth it, since that collaboration is the reason we have a Slaad infestation today.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The slaad anarch polemic and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the slaad anarch polemic dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: The slaad anarch polemic rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Paragon Resilliency
entries: The slaad anarch has three health totals, which deplete one at a time. When one health total is depleted, the slaad anarch gains a second wind, recovering from any status effect affecting it. When all health totals are depleted, the slaad anarch dies.

trait.name: Chaotic Nature
entries: The slaad anarch's form is unstable, constantly shifting and bubbling. At the start of the slaad anarch's turn, roll a {@dice 1d2} (or flip a coin). Depending on the result of the roll, the slaad anarch might change stat blocks. If it changes stat blocks, it retains its current hit point total and all conditions currently affecting it, but otherwise replaces all of its statistics with those of the new stat block. The possible stat blocks are:
1. Slaad Anarch Polemic
2. Slaad Anarch Exemplar

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The slaad anarch regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. This healing cannot restore a depleted hit point pool, only fill a partially depleted one.

action.name: Rant
entries: Cooldown 3. The slaad anarch polemic rants at a specific enemy. Until the cooldown on Rant refreshes, all of the slaad anarch polemic's allies gain advantage to attack the target of the rant, and if they hit, deal an additional 5 psychic damage.

action.name: Ray of Acid
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Betray Underling
entries: As a reaction when the slaad anarch polemic would be the target of an attack, he may force the attack to target an adjacent ally instead.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 15

entries.name: Description (Polemic form)
entries: This slaad's skin glistens a mottled green. It walks almost hunched over and carries a staff, as if elderly, and a keen intelligence shines in its eyes. The other slaad seem to defer to it, even if they don't realize they are doing so.

entries.name: Description (Exemplar form)
entries: The slaad's form bubbles and changes, its skill staying green, but its slump straightening out. Lean muscle bubbles up along its limbs, and its staff twists into a long glaive. The edge of sharp, malicious intelligence in its eyes is unchanged.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Slaad are fundamentally unmanageable creatures of chaos. They cannot be commanded or persuaded, and they are often contrary simply for the sake of it. But intelligent Slaad have realized that the best way to get a Slaad to do what you want to do is tell it to do the exact opposite.

The possible stat blocks are:

action.name: Acid Launch
entries: Cooldown 3. The slaad anarch exemplar expels a burst of acid in a 15 ft. cube centered on itself. All creatures in the cube must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 acid damage and losing their reaction on a failure.
The slaad anarch exemplar uses this burst to push itself into the air, jumping 15 ft. and landing in an unoccupied space.

The acid stays after the initial burst, forming a pool on the ground in the same area as the burst. Any creature that starts its turn in the pool or moves into it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 3 acid damage on a failure.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 slashing damage.

action.name: Trip Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. The target cannot be adjacent to the slaad anarch exemplar. {@h}7 bludgeoning damage and the target must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the slaad anarch exemplar can make a Glaive attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the giant turtle is bloodied (30), it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or retreat into its shell and take no more actions for the remainder of the combat.

trait.name: Bulk
entries: Large creatures have half cover when behind the giant turtle. Medium creatures have 3/4 cover when behind the giant turtle. Smaller creatures have full cover when behind the giant turtle.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 piercing damage.

action.name: Shell Retreat
entries: The giant turtle retreats all of its limbs back into its shell and focuses on defense. While it is focusing on defense in this manner, its speed drops to 0 ft. and it gains 3/4 cover from all attacks. It can still make normal attacks and attacks of opportunity, but it cannot make shoves. The giant turtle may end its shell retreat with a bonus action.

bonus.name: Shove
entries: The giant turtle shoves a target with its shell. The target must make a {@dc 12} saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Nature DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: A turtle of truly titanic proportions. Oddly, at a glance it seems to be better suited for the water than the land, but it seems to plod along just fine. It's hooked beak looks strong enough to punch through steel.

entries.name: Lore
entries: One of the more humiliating episodes in the Skybridge-Githyanki war saw Gith invaders simply sailing into central Skybridge on flying turtles, our defenses completely helpless against their armor. The invaders were eventually repelled, but several turtles escaped into the sewers to become eternal pests.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the fleshpecker is bloodied (4), it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The fleshpecker doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 piercing damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Nature DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: An evil-looking black bird with a pointed beak. You can't quite tell, but you think there might be bloodstains on its chest feathers.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Consistent pests brought to Skybridge from the Old World. Probably not on purpose. Usually, fleshpeckers are scavengers, but they aren't above creating a meal with their own beaks.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The giant rat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the giant rat's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the giant rat is bloodied (9), it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 piercing damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Nature DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: A rat that has grown to rival large dogs. Despite its size, it looks thin and desperate, eyeing you with unmistakable hunger.

entries.name: Lore
entries: The failing Chaos Engine causes all manner of strange mutations in creatures unlucky enough to be exposed to it. This rat isn't one of them, though. Its ancestors stowed away on Skybridge, and all of them looked this ugly.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The elder red slaad and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the elder red slaad dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: The elder red slaad rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Paragon Resilliency

Depending on the result of the roll, the elder red slaad might change stat blocks. If it changes stat blocks, it retains its current hit point total and all conditions currently affecting it, but otherwise replaces all of its statistics with those of the new stat block. The possible stat blocks are:
1. Elder Red Slaad Acidspitter
2. Elder Red Slaad Ovipositor

entries: The elder red slaad regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. This healing cannot restore a depleted hit point pool, only fill a partially depleted one.

trait.name: Acid Burst
entries: Any creature that strikes the elder red slaad with a melee attack takes 5 points of acid damage.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 acid damage and an acid glob sticks to the target. While the glob remains on the target, it takes 5 acid damage at the start of its turn and its AC is reduced by 2. The glob may be removed as an action, but it deals 5 acid damage to the object or creature that removes it.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The elder red slaad and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the elder red slaad dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury

trait.name: Paragon Resilliency

trait.name: Chaotic Nature
entries: The elder red slaad's form is unstable, constantly shifting and bubbling. At the start of the elder red slaad's turn, roll a {@dice 1d2}. Depending on the result of the roll, the elder red slaad might change stat blocks. If it changes stat blocks, it retains its current hit point total and all conditions currently affecting it, but otherwise replaces all of its statistics with those of the new stat block. The possible stat blocks are:
1. Elder Red Slaad Acidspitter
2. Elder Red Slaad Ovipositor

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The elder red slaad regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. This healing cannot restore a depleted hit point pool, only fill a partially depleted one.

trait.name: Leap
entries: The elder red slaad may leap its full movement speed as a move action. When it does this, it does not provoke opportunity attacks from creatures that it passes over during its movement. It does, however, provoke opportunity attacks from creatures that were adjacent to it at the beginning of its leap.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elder red slaad makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its egg claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 piercing damage.

action.name: Egg Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be infected by a disease - a minuscule slaad egg. A target cannot be infected by the disease more than once.

A creature inflicted with the disease is {@condition poisoned} and its speed is halved. At the end of each of its turns, the creature may make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, ending the slowing and poisoning on a success. The slowing and poisoning also end after 10 minutes if they have not already. This success does not cure the disease, merely suppresses its symptoms.

Creatures that are infected with a slaad egg but have suppressed the symptoms can tell that they are sick, but the disease does not impact their functioning. This feeling of sickness gradually gets worse over the course of 1 month. 1 month after being infected with the disease, the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} and slowed again. 1 week after the poisoning and slowing begin again, a slaad tadpole bursts out of the creature's chest, killing it instantly.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 15

entries.name: Description (Acidspitter form)
entries: Mottled red covers this slaad's form, mirroring its furious expression. It is the largest slaad you have ever seen. Its arms and legs seem oddly spindly contrasted against its great barrel chest. Acidic saliva slowly drips from its mouth.

entries.name: Description (Ovipositor form)
entries: The huge slaad's form ripples and twists, muscle moving away from the torso and into the arms and legs. It grins at you through a new mouth of razor teeth and brandishes a single, long, vicious claw. A sinister, highly-viscous liquid drips off the tip.

entries.name: Lore
entries: All slaad are creatures of chaos, but as they age, they tend to specialize in specific forms of mayhem. These forms of elder slaad can often be distinguished by color. Red elders focus on bringing new slaad (and thus more chaos) into the world.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The rat king and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the rat king dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When the rat king reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it transforms into Rat King (Phase 2). In so doing, it gains all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and recovers from any status affects afflicting it.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: The Rat King rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Tackle
entries: If the rat king moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}. If the target is {@condition grappled}, the rat king can make one gnaw attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 piercing damage.

action.name: Gnaw
entries: Deal 18 piercing damage to a {@condition grappled} target.

bonus.name: Spring
entries: If the rat king has a target {@condition grappled}, he may spring off the target 10 ft. in any direction he chooses. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Pillar of Cowardice
entries: When the rat king is bloodied (26), it and all creatures under its command break morale immediately and attempt to flee the combat.

trait.name: Tackle
entries: If the rat king moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}. If the target is {@condition grappled}, the rat king can make one gnaw attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Desperate Rush
entries: If the rat king moves at least 20 ft. in a straight line, creatures in the line are shoved 5 ft. out of the way and must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or lose their reaction for the round.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 piercing damage.

action.name: Gnaw
entries: Deal 18 piercing damage to a {@condition grappled} target.

bonus.name: Spring
entries: If the rat king has a target {@condition grappled}, he may spring off the target 10 ft. in any direction he chooses. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
