entries: Nature DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: This rat has been twisted by arcane energies into a somewhat humanoid shape. As a marker of its authority, the Rat King jammed its twisted form into an ill-fitting suit of gleaming silver armor.

entries.name: Lore
entries: In these fallen days, Chaos energy permeates Skybridge. Those creatures that spend too long within its influence find themselves changed. Often the change is bad for the creature, but sometimes it is dubiously blessed by increased strength, speed, or senses.

trait.name: Part of the Whole
entries: The elder turtle foot is only a small part of a greater monster. As a result, the elder turtle foot has advantage when saving against all effects that require an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, but those effects affect every part of the greater monster. Successfully dominating one body part dominates all body parts, for instance.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The elder turtle foot and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When MON dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Biological Restrictions
entries: The elder turtle's feet may never "cross over" one another. For example, the right forefoot may never go further left than the left forefoot, or behind either rear foot.

action.name: Stomp
entries: The elder turtle places its foot down forcefully. All creatures sharing a space with the elder turtle foot or adjacent to the foot must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 bludgeoning damage and falling {@condition prone} on a failure, or taking half as much damage on a success.

Creatures under the foot that succeeded on their save are pushed to the nearest unoccupied space. Creatures under the foot that failed their save are {@condition restrained}. A creature {@condition restrained} in this way can use its action to make a Strength check against {@dc 12}. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained} and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space.
If the elder turtle foot moves or uses any action other than Squish, any creatures currently {@condition restrained} by it are freed.

action.name: Squish
entries: Requires a {@condition restrained} creature. Deals 13 bludgeoning damage to the {@condition restrained} creature.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 bludgeoning damage. The target must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be thrown up to 15 ft and fall {@condition prone} on a square of the elder turtle's choosing.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Nature DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: Streams of dust fall down into the square as the elder turtle moves muscles that it hasn't stretched since the days of your ancestors. An enormous head swings down to stare at you with nothing more than mild annoyance.

entries.name: Lore
entries: The Old General was the largest of the turtles brought by the Githyanki, and the only one that can still truly fly in this day and age. Skybridge's knights drove it off several times, but it never failed to return. Even if its return took decades, Skybridge always had too much good food to pass up.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The githyanki raider makes 2 shock blade attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, that target loses its reaction for the turn.

action.name: Shock Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 slashing damage and 2 lightning damage.

bonus.name: Planar Journey
entries: The githyanki teleports up to 10 ft. to an unoccupied space.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the githyanki raider is bloodied (16), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: History DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: If you could judge githyanki by human standards, this gith would look young. They also look vicious and bloodthirsty. The gith's armor, while neat and clearly well taken care of, is just as clearly lower quality than that of other gith soldiers.

entries.name: Lore
entries: During the period of alliance, Setrar was asked by a Bridger why her culture allowed their youth to take the furthest-forward, most dangerous positions in battle. According to rumor, Setrar responded, "Allow? We require it. How else are they to earn glory?"

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the githyanki knight is bloodied (18), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or break morale. When a majority of the githyanki knight's allies have broken morale, they all attempt to retreat together.

bonus.name: Planar Journey
entries: The githyanki teleports up to 10 ft. to an unoccupied space.

action.name: Silver Lightning Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 slashing damage and 3 lightning damage. The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the beginning of the githyanki knight's next turn.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: History DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: This warrior wears plates of solid metal, but their yellow skin clearly visible through the armor plates clearly marks them as gith. They and their allies seem to work together without needing to speak, forming up and raising their crackling blades.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Setrar spared no expense in outfitting even her common foot soldiers. Reportedly, this caused her generals to grumble until her strategies started winning victories for the clan. Those strategies also won her the fanatical loyalties of the lower ranks.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Diras and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Diras dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Diras rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Paragon Resilliency
entries: Diras has three health totals, which deplete one at a time. When one health total is depleted, Diras gains a second wind, recovering from any status effect affecting it. When all health totals are depleted, Diras dies.

bonus.name: Planar Journey
entries: The githyanki teleports up to 10 ft. to an unoccupied space.

bonus.name: Spatial Hook
entries: One creature within 30 ft. must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be teleported to the nearest space adjacent to Diras. A target teleported this way has disadvantage on saving throws to resist Diras' abilities and Diras has advantage on attacks against them until the end of Diras' current turn.

action.name: Sword of Life Stealing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 slashing damage and Diras heals 5 hp. This healing cannot restore a health pool that is already at 0.

action.name: Lifewell
entries: Only available when Diras has only one health pool remaining. All creatures adjacent to Diras must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 8 necrotic damage on a failure. Diras heals 3 hp for each creature that failed. This healing cannot restore a health pool that is already at 0.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: History DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: The Githyanki knight steps forward, raising a black longsword that seems to crackle with black energy. Rubies stud his armor around the shoulders and chest. He smirks smirks casually before his sword moves in a blur to attack.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Among the Setrari Githyanki, armor adornments are used to indicate rank and status. Byzantine rituals dictate exactly where a Gith is allowed to adorn their armor and with what stones. Rubies in particular indicate blood shed in battle.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: Lythoth and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When Lynoth dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: Lynoth rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.

trait.name: Paragon Resilliency
entries: Lynoth has three health totals, which deplete one at a time. When one health total is depleted, Lynoth gains a second wind, recovering from any status effect affecting it. When all health totals are depleted, Lynoth dies.

bonus.name: Planar Journey
entries: The githyanki teleports up to 10 ft. to an unoccupied space.

action.name: Lightning Bolt
entries: Lynoth produces a lightning bolt in a 30 ft. line. All creatures within the lightning bolt must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Dimensional Sanctuary
entries: Lynoth brings himself out of phase with reality, provoking an attack of opportunity while doing so. While out of phase in this way, he can neither affect normal reality, not be affected by anything in it. He is utterly undetectable from normal reality. He can still move and take actions that affect only himself.
If Lynoth ends his turn in the sanctuary, he restores 3 hp. This healing cannot restore a health pool that is already at 0.
Lynoth can end his sanctuary with a bonus action.

action.name: Banishment
entries: Only available after Lynoth has lost at least 1 health pool. A creature that Lynoth touches must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be put out of phase with reality. This state is identical to Dimensional Sanctuary, except that it does not heal the target. The target may repeat the Wisdom save at the end of each of its turns, returning to normal reality on a success.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: History DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: A male Githyanki with severe, understated robes strides in the center of a formation of other Gith, clearly its focus. His stoic frown is accented by the large red ruby he wears on his forehead. Barely restrained lightning crackles around his fingers.

entries.name: Lore
entries: The Setrari Githyanki, unlike other bands, do not focus on the mental arts in their magics. Instead, they have developed a style of spatial arts and lightning magic that is notoriously difficult to counter. A Setrari mage can be anywhere you do not want them to be.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the githyanki gish is bloodied (22), it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

action.name: Lightning Bolt
entries: The githyanki gish produces a lightning bolt in a 40 ft. line. All creatures within the lightning bolt must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 20 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Dimensional Sanctuary
entries: The githyanki gish brings themself out of phase with reality, provoking an attack of opportunity while doing so. While out of phase in this way, they can neither affect normal reality, not be affected by anything in it. They are utterly undetectable from normal reality. They can still move and take actions that affect only themself.
If the githyanki gish ends their turn in the sanctuary, they restore 5 hp.
The githyanki gish can end their sanctuary with a bonus action.

bonus.name: Planar Journey
entries: The githyanki teleports up to 10 ft. to an unoccupied space.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: History DC 16

entries.name: Description
entries: Rather than armor, this Githyanki wears a black robe, offset by earth toned under-robes. Their clothing is not ornate, but it sewn in several places with shining clear crystals. A large red ruby graces their brow, and their hands and eyes crackle with lightning.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Each unit in the Githyanki military often has an entirely separate chain of command, which can lead to large differences, even within the same band. Setrari gish, for instance, are lead by an Overcaptain with an infamous disdain for military maneuvers and fondness of magical research.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the slaad shaman is bloodied (49), it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The slaad shaman regains 8 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: The Mind Killer
entries: Cooldown 3. The slaad shaman focuses on one target, which must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 52 psychic damage and becoming {@condition frightened} of the slaad shaman on a failed save, or taking half as much damage on a successful one. Frightened creatures may repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves on a success.

action.name: Acidic Storm
entries: Cooldown 3. The slaad shaman throws a mote of magic up to 30 ft. away, which explodes into a 20 ft. radius sphere of powerful acid. Each creature in the sphere must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 32 acid damage on a failure, and half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Chaotic Restoration
entries: The slaad shaman touches themselves or an ally to restore 8 hp.
The slaad shaman can use this ability on an ally that has died since the end of the shaman's last turn, restoring it from 0 to 8 hp.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Arcana DC 17

entries.name: Description
entries: This slaad's skin is a sickly green, and in contrast to most other slaad you have seen, does not bubble constantly. It is almost stonelike in texture, and the slaad moves with the painful difficulty of an arthritic. Still, you are wary of the dangerous glint in its eyes.

entries.name: Lore
entries: As slaad age, they calcify. The chaos that gives them life slowly ebbs until they turn to stone. Particularly intelligent and magically gifted slaad are able to delay this process, and can often live several times the lifespans of their less gifted cousins.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny skull. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. The swarm has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that affect an area and advantage on saving throws against effects that affect a single creature.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the skull swarm is bloodied (30), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or stop moving and pretend to be a pile of inanimate bones.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in one of the swarm's spaces. {@h}8 piercing damage. {@m}4 piercing damage.

reaction.name: Choking Dust
entries: If the skull swarm fails its saving throw against a damaging area attack, several of the damaged skulls may explode violently, spreading choking dust over its own spaces and all spaces adjacent to it. All creatures in those spaces that need to breathe must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 15 points of poison damage on a failure and 7 points on a success.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: Your attention drifts to the skulls on the walls, and are chilled to discover that they are all pointed in your direction. A forest of eye pinpricks light up in the dark, and the skulls lunge at you, chattering in a foul imitation of laughter.

entries.name: Lore
entries: When Necromantic Devourers began settling in Skybridge's Ossuary, the solution recommended by many was to begin burying skulls instead of entire corpses. Surely, the reasoning went, the demons will be less dangerous without full bodies to animate.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 piercing damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Nature DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: A slight tremor is all the warning you get as centipedes the size of large dogs erupt out of every wall, chattering jaws tearing at armor and flesh.

entries.name: Lore
entries: These creatures were brought onto Skybridge from the old world with the idea that they would become some sort of food source. Mostly, they became dangerous and difficult pests, but centipede meat did become something of a delicacy to Bridgers.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the giant centipede is bloodied (9), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The skeletal amalgam and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the skeletal amalgam dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The skeletal amalgam can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Paragon Transformation
entries: When the skeletal amalgam reaches 0 hp, instead of dying, it splits into two Skeletal Amalgams (Phase 2). Both new monsters gain all of the statistics of the second phase, including its full hp total, and do not inherit any status effects from the first amalgam.

trait.name: Unpredictable Movements
entries: The skeletal amalgam can take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 piercing damage.

action.name: Ceiling Drop
entries: When the skeletal amalgam is climbing on the ceiling of a room, it may detach from the ceiling and slam into any creatures below. Creatures that would be inside the skeletal amalgam's space are shoved to the nearest unoccupied space. All creatures adjacent to the skeletal amalgam after its drop, including shoved creatures, must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. If any creatures are knocked {@condition prone} in this way, the skeletal amalgam may make a Bites attack against them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The skeletal amalgam and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the skeletal amalgam dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The skeletal amalgam can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unpredictable Movements
entries: The skeletal amalgam can take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 piercing damage.

action.name: Ceiling Drop
entries: When the skeletal amalgam is climbing on the ceiling of a room, it may detach from the ceiling and slam into any creatures below. Creatures that would be inside the skeletal amalgam's space are shoved to the nearest unoccupied space. All creatures adjacent to the skeletal amalgam after its drop, including shoved creatures, must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. If any creatures are knocked {@condition prone} in this way, the skeletal amalgam may make a Bites attack against them as a bonus action.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: With a grim sense of foreboding, your gaze drifts to the ceiling. Your eyes lock with the flickering lights of an undead skull. One of dozens studding the body of the undead abomination like armor. Dozens of skeletal arms reach and clutch the stone. Dozens of skeletal ribcages flex in an imitation of breath. All of the creature's skulls grin in unison. Then it drops from the ceiling towards you.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Gluttons will often toss the parts of a corpse they aren't interested in eating into a single pile, like some demented imitation of hygiene. Occasionally, a Necromantic Devourer comes across these charnel piles. The results should not be spoken of lightly.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The imp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the imp is bloodied (16), it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or flee the combat.

action.name: Hellflame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit +5} to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. {@h}13 fire damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the beginning of the imp's next turn by visions of suffering.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: A tiny, bony fiend with a malicious smirk. Its horns and wings give size and intimidation to its emaciated body. Cursed fire flickers in its eyes and hands.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Since the summoning and subsequent sealing of the Broken Horror, Skybridge has experienced a relatively constant "demon leakage" problem. Most of the time, the leaked demons are imps. Occasionally, they are far worse creatures.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The barbed devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Barbs
entries: Any creature that strikes the barbed devil with a melee attack takes 5 points of piercing damage.

action.name: Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or become {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the barbed devil can't hook another target.

action.name: Tear
entries: Requires a {@condition grappled} target. The {@condition grappled} target takes 18 piercing damage.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: The creature steps out of the shadows, revealing itself to be a thin humanoid, oddly proportioned with short but powerful legs and too-long arms. Everything about it is sharp, from the spines covering its skin to its malicious glare.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Barbed devils were often summoned by the ambitious to act as guards and assassins. The creatures' tenacity and viciousness were highly prized. Unfortunately for their prospective masters, the devils were more then willing to turn those traits to their own ends.

trait.name: Pillar of Will
entries: The necromantic devourer and all creatures under its command never make morale checks while it is alive. When the necromantic devourer dies, all creatures under its command immediately make a morale check.

trait.name: Paragon Fury
entries: While the necromantic devourer still has its first health bar, it rolls initiative again and gains a second turn in the initiative order. Its reaction refreshes and its cooldowns tick down at the beginning of each turn.
When the necromantic devourer's first health bar is depleted, it loses one of its turns at random, and thereafter only takes a single initiative turn as normal.

trait.name: Paragon Resilliency
entries: The necromantic devourer has two health totals, which deplete one at a time. When one health total is depleted, the necromantic devourer gains a second wind, recovering from any status effect affecting it. When all health totals are depleted, the necromantic devourer dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The necromantic devourer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

bonus.name: Command Undead
entries: An allied undead creature within 90 ft. is granted an action which it must use immediately, on the necromantic devourer's turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 piercing damage, and the necromantic devourer clings to the target. The target may detach the necromantic devourer with a {@dc 14} Strength check.

While the necromantic devourer is clinging to a target, it cannot move away from the target, and it moves with the target as it moves. It gains advantage to bite a target that it is clinging to, and three-quarters cover against attacks from all other creatures than the one it is clinging to.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: Religion DC 15

entries.name: Description
entries: At first glance, the creature is almost cute, like a squirrel without the tail. A second glance reveals that that is not a nut the creature is crunching on, but a human femur. Its gaze burns with a cold, magical intensity. The creature chitters mockingly at you as it vanishes into the shadows.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Necromantic devourers are not often summoned. They are widely considered impossible to control because of their ability to create minions for themselves out of any dead creature. How this one got to Skybridge is a mystery, but it seems to have done quite well here.

trait.name: Morale
entries: When the Alhoon is bloodied (49), it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or break morale. When a majority of the Alhoon's allies have broken morale, they all attempt to retreat together.

trait.name: Suffering Link
entries: Whenever the Alhoon takes damage, any creatures {@condition stunned} by this Alhoon's Mind Blast must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or take half the damage as psychic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Alhoon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Mind Blast
entries: Cooldown 3. All creatures of the Alhoon's choice within 15 ft. must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, taking 30 psychic damage and becoming {@condition stunned} for 1 minute on a failure and taking 15 psychic damage on a success.
A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Alhoon makes two Vampyric Bolt attacks.

action.name: Vampyric Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit +9} to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. {@h}17 necrotic damage. If the target is {@condition stunned} by this Alhoon's Mind Blast, the Alhoon restores 6 hp.

reaction.name: Counterspell
entries: Cooldown 3. As the spell {@spell counterspell} at 5th level.

entries.name: Stat Block DC
entries: History DC 17

entries.name: Description
entries: The mind flayer before you would look like any other of its kind if not for its abnormally pale skin, which looks dried and cracked. Then it raises a hand to prepare a spell, and you can see places where its flesh has sloughed off to expose bone. This mind flayer was never alive in the first place.

entries.name: Lore
entries: Alhoon are Illithids that pursue a modified form of lichdom to attain immortality. Shunned even by most other Illithid colonies, Lord Qhen provides a refuge for these misfits. In return, they serve him loyally, acting as his most dangerous enforcers and consuming those that challenge him.
